bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Expresses the sense of Congress that the U.S. flag flown over the U.S. Capitol should be lowered to half-mast one day each month in honor of the men and women from the United States who have lost their lives in military conflicts.
